positive.review:
absolute best productivity app/game ever. everything i was looking for
1. customizable characters
2. customizable rooms
3. rain ambience
4. cozy music that doesn't distract
5. super cute character/outfit/object models
6. multiplayerrrrrr
7. pomodoro timer sound that doesn't give me a heart attack

and now that it has multiplayer it's even better because i work better when i know there's someone else locking in too nearby me. the amount of communication between players (emojis) is just nice because i think chatting would be very distracting/like any other game. love when we exchange hi and go about our work

nothing but pure comfy~

if you're looking for a cozy game to have running in the background while you work, study, or just chill, this one does the job perfectly. it's relaxing and sets such a nice atmosphere that it makes everything else you're doing feel a bit lighter

I really like this little game, it's super cute and it's really helping me to focus. Love the online rooms, players are incredibly creative. This game's got great assets. Everyone's character is so cute !

The game DO need more care on certain aspects, especially in the customization, lots of clipping with the clothes, accessories like tails are sometimes placed too high on the character. Also not a fan of the blue outline on absolutely every 3D objects, looks a little weird a lot of the time, a black or dark brown outline would have suit better i think. I feel like the HUD could be better and add more identity to the game. Just need to be a little more polished overall but it's really off a great start. 

Also more customization please !! c:
I'm usually not into things like this, because it actually kind of does help me focus a bit more and I have ADHD, so that's interesting. It's cute.

It's a great game, it's already helping me create a routine!

I hope they continue developing and bringing content that can enhance the experience, I'm in love with it; ♡

Not really a review but if there isn't already an option to, I'd like to make a request to be able to add songs to a 'Favorites' list or to be able to have our own custom playlists that include both local and game soundtracks?

For those who like utility apps and productivity tools, gogh: Focus with Your Avatar is one of those games I would definitely recommend. What I like most about this game are two things: 1. the ability to design your room: you can upload images and GIFs, items could overlap and such, (the possibilities are endless!), and 2. the multiplayer feature, where you can join your friends' (even rando's) rooms, and even show off your own rooms whenever you feel like it. 

So far, I see so much potential in this game, and I would love to see more content pouring all over! Can't wait to see more Kuroda's in the collection, more items for use and display, and probably fun activities or mini games with your friends, who knows!
Please add an option to disable Kuroda permanently, or at least an option to remember that I hid it so that I don't have to keep doing it on launch every time.

I have been looking for a game like this for some time. I used chill corner first but this is peak. 
Its super customizable and the graphics are beautiful. This is super underrated!

Hoping they add more customization options later, but overall I really recommend it!

I came to this game to sit around with friends as we either talked during break time or worked together.
It's funny to see people sitting/sleeping in weird places after coming back from a 25-min work.

Maybe modded clothing, modded furniture, maybe even community room layouts so not every room is just a square or larger square. Seems pretty good, clearly a pretty early build, but otherwise promising with what it has.
My biggest complaint is that there is, as far as I can tell, no device syncing between the Steam Version and the phone version, which is a big turn off, considering its routine planning and other features it'd be fantastic to be able to make the room on my computer, then when I'm walking around I can use the phone app to check what I need to do, instead you're being forced to either maintain both routines, to do lists, timers, etc, or not interact with one of the versions.

I was unsure how effective something like this would be for me, but I figured I'd give it a shot. The initial creation stuff can be time consuming if you want things to look good and personalized, but once that's all squared away you don't have to worry about anything else. I also assumed that the Pomodoro timer wouldn't work for the way I do things, but I tried it and honestly I've been super productive! I really like how you can hang out with others while not being distracted (no in-game chat, just emotes, so you know most people are working). Kinda gives the feeling of a friend study group or parallel play haha. Definitely worth the price for how much it's helped me! :)

Very cute app! I bought this to be more productive but then I ended up spending 10 hours customizing everything. There's not that many customization options for character creation but the variety of things there is very good, I was able to make most of my OCs and myself into the game. It also doesn't take up that much computer power so I'm basically using it as my wallpaper for my second monitor when I'm not using the timer to focus. I bought this on a complete whim so I'm very happy with how randomly attached I got to this app.

It's also great for ambient noise- You can turn on and off 24 different ambient noises/variants and adjust how loud each thing is. I also like that I can add gifs and images to certain items, as well as draw on things with what I understand is the newest patch :D

Of course the game does have issues, like how the item placement isn't great- sometimes you can't move items even if you have grid placement off, mostly when things are near the ceiling or the corners of the room. Items also snap to the center your mouse on the item, so placing rugs underneath pre-existing furniture is a nightmare sometimes because there's no option to send an item to the lowest layer, so sometimes you have to move everything away from the area you want to put a rug, then put everything back after you place the rug, etc.

Does a great job of simulating the experience of studying in a coffee shop with others. I like the avatar customization much more than Spirit City, and I think the music is better too. Being able to join public rooms is a great feature, but mired by losing Pomodoro timer status if the room is closed while you are in it, huge oversight I hope the devs fix soon. Other than that the game is excellent with a huge amount of customization options.

The game is alright, it's cozy and very customizable to fit each player's individual needs, the price is fairly cheap (especially on sale), and it seems to be receiving frequent updates, so I look forward to seeing how it will evolve over time. Who knows, by the time you read this review, it might offer a very different experience from when I wrote it – less than two months ago it didn't even have multiplayer, yet now it's one of the main features advertised on the store page.

With that being said, I feel like the character customization needs some work still. It's so hard to find pieces of clothing that fit together without noticeably clipping into each other, and the color customization is also extremely limited to the point where it often makes it actively [i]harder[/i] to match different pieces together, thus defeating the point. Moreover, the undo function is... kind of broken, which is especially a problem when considering that for some reason you often can't edit a piece of clothing you have already equipped without unequipping it and re-equipping it first, which resets any preexisting customization. It's not a dealbreaker for me, but I'm not the first to complain about stuff like this, so it would be nice to see this system expanded and improved in future updates.

I got interested in this game because I already owned My Dream Setup, but that one didn’t let you have an avatar, track tasks, or do anything beyond customizing rooms. Gogh, on the other hand, immediately caught my attention because it includes all those extra features. I can create my avatar, add my tasks, and even customize my music. The music system is especially interesting because you can link a local folder from your PC and use your own songs as an in-game playlist, and you can even assign a custom cover image from your computer.

One thing I really loved about My Dream Setup was the ability to add custom images to frames, posters, monitors, and screens, and Gogh also has that, which is great. Still, there are several downsides. You can’t change the size of rooms, freely scale furniture, or recolor certain parts of objects. Some furniture comes in colors like white and pink, and the game only allows recoloring the white part, not the pink, which is frustrating. You also can’t add or remove doors and windows wherever you want, which severely limits room customization. In My Dream Setup, you could even draw the entire floorplan from scratch, so I was able to recreate my room perfectly there. In Gogh, even the largest room preset is still too small for my real bedroom.

There is also a noticeable lack of furniture variety. My Dream Setup includes detolfs, which are extremely popular among figure collectors, and Gogh would really benefit from items like that. The game could also use more frame and poster proportions, especially 1:1 square formats and round frames. On top of that, Gogh really needs more types of basic furniture, such as larger mirrors, proper wardrobes, and different PC cases, including mini-tower cases like the one I use in real life.

Another issue that many players, including me, have experienced is that the to-do lists sometimes reset, causing all tasks to disappear. That’s a pretty big problem considering that productivity is one of the main focuses of the game.

All of these limitations affect the customization experience, especially when trying to recreate a real room. It would also be great if we could scale the length of avatar hairstyles, since many cute styles are way too short for what I wanted.

Overall, that’s everything. If the game eventually improves these features, it would be absolutely perfect.

negative.review:
The Game is still cooking!

This game needs a lot of work still. If you have any of the focus timers set, you can't touch settings or anything else at all without turning off the timer.

New eggs don't spawn right away after reading your letter from your previous buddy.

There isn't much help out there, in English, if you run into issues or have questions.

There's a lot of clipping of your avatar through things like pillows, back of the chair, etc.

It is neat that in *MOST* places where there is a "9" that you can swap it out for a custom image or .gif. However, there are places where you can't swap out the "9" such as the animations of your avatar playing on the laptop or phone.

Overall, it's neat and has potential, but it's not done baking yet.
Not recommended yet.

I really like the concept of this game and I hope to see more games like this come out. Very enjoyable and keeps me focused on my tasks. However, I do have some major issues with the game. The main one is that the kuroda pets grow based on real time. As someone who works and has a social life, I'm not able to be glued to my computer 24/7 to keep track of my in game tasks. I'm sure most people who have a life outside of this game would agree that it's very annoying to have the pets grow based on how productive you are. Not only that, but the letters you receive from theses pets are annoying too. 

 My other issue with the game is the lack of avatar customization so far. Mostly the lack of different skin  colors. I'm sure after a few more updates, the devs will deal with that. I'd suggest focusing on the skin colors and also maybe add a color wheel with hex codes you can enter.

 My third issue with the game is the bugs that come with it. Every so often my game will crash and all of my tasks are gone and replaced with "To Do" My game also freezes sometimes when I'm editing my rooms. 

Other than all that, it's a pretty neat game. Looking forward to new updates.

no chat: refund - doesn't make sense to me not having chat lobbies or various options at at least.

no. it is not distracting. why would it be? you are the devs - implement 'options'. give it a show/hide toggle, mute option, block option, opt-in prompts, per room settings, c'mon.

This is not a "game", but it's a great great productivity tool! (especially if you have a second monitor)

I love hanging out with other productive people for some dose of peer pressure to keep you going. Plus, gogh keeps me from getting distracted by other games, because to have the best framerate in other games you have to close gogh, which means leaving your friends.. 

This game fixed my productive life ヾ(≧▽≦*)o

Needs some more time in the oven before i can recommend. What we have currently is awesome but there are some bugs that make the whole experience rough, My gripe is with the to-do list as i've had multiple post either completely disappear or revert back to a blank "To-Do" box again. once these bugs are fixed  ill change my review but in the meanwhile i can't recommend this product.
May allah forgive me for lowering my testosterone playing this game.
need... moer.... customization....

I absolutely LOVE this game. Its essentially a productivity and social game mashed together, I haven't seen anything like it, and its a great type of community to build if you think about it. Its a bit buggy but so far the devs are pretty regular with updates. 

[b]My only reason for a negative review, is that there is no start screen.[/b]
It automatically puts you in the last room you own that you were in. If you accidentally overload your room, you will not be able to load the game anymore. I am currently locked out until they make this adjustment, and I advise if you do play the game in its current state you keep your room minimal.
There is no option to sync with mobile app. I'd gladly buy it again if there was an option to sync my progress on mobile to here

The Game is still cooking!

This game needs a lot of work still. If you have any of the focus timers set, you can't touch settings or anything else at all without turning off the timer.

New eggs don't spawn right away after reading your letter from your previous buddy.

There isn't much help out there, in English, if you run into issues or have questions.

There's a lot of clipping of your avatar through things like pillows, back of the chair, etc.

It is neat that in *MOST* places where there is a "9" that you can swap it out for a custom image or .gif. However, there are places where you can't swap out the "9" such as the animations of your avatar playing on the laptop or phone.

Overall, it's neat and has potential, but it's not done baking yet.
Not recommended yet.

Not worth the money, since multiplayer doesn't work properly. And I only bought it because of that. There are free singleplayer competitor games.

In 99% of the time when I join a room, and it says, that people should be in there, there is noone. 

I guess, if you always play with a friend, then it's worth it.

I really like the concept of this game and I hope to see more games like this come out. Very enjoyable and keeps me focused on my tasks. However, I do have some major issues with the game. The main one is that the kuroda pets grow based on real time. As someone who works and has a social life, I'm not able to be glued to my computer 24/7 to keep track of my in game tasks. I'm sure most people who have a life outside of this game would agree that it's very annoying to have the pets grow based on how productive you are. Not only that, but the letters you receive from theses pets are annoying too. 

 My other issue with the game is the lack of avatar customization so far. Mostly the lack of different skin  colors. I'm sure after a few more updates, the devs will deal with that. I'd suggest focusing on the skin colors and also maybe add a color wheel with hex codes you can enter.

 My third issue with the game is the bugs that come with it. Every so often my game will crash and all of my tasks are gone and replaced with "To Do" My game also freezes sometimes when I'm editing my rooms. 

Other than all that, it's a pretty neat game. Looking forward to new updates.

I mean, I really do like this game, but it falls short on many accounts. I have a lot of graphic issues during the room design process and the colour palette is extremely limiting. I like that I'm able to import photos, but there's no aspect ratio described for 99% of these items and they really do need it because they are not intuitive at all. I haven't had issues making darker skin as a COLOUR, but the lines for the mouth and all that stay as the regular grey-ish and it looks awful. I wish there was a lot more options for furniture; more options for natural-looking pillows, blankets, etc. Some items that should go together(like the bed + pillows) do not at all, it's not cohesive. The grid is also INFURIATING. why isn't it lined up with the wall??

When it comes to the actual studying part of the game, I think it does exactly as it's supposed to, I mean, it's not a very complex feature. I don't think this would make me any more likely to study(and it hasn't so far), but with multiplayer the whole body-doubling aspect of it might change that up. All-in-all it's very cute and relaxing to watch, but mostly as a second-screen kind of thing.

I encounter a of bugs, I've had rooms not save(A LOT, might be a cloud issue im not sure), etc. common issues that make me never wanna play again(for a week) but I can get over it.

That being said, it is a very relaxing game with a lot of potential. I think in a few updates I will be able to recommend this game, but for now, it's lacking a lot of what I'm looking for ntm I'm STILL failing all my classes.

features that would be great:
- steam workshop (would LOVEEE this)
- play local audio files in-game
- resizing of 3D objects(like the cube, sphere, wtv make them longer or skinnier or shorter or fatter)

or simply revert the fake multiplayer part and advertise it as what it is. I really don't enjoy sitting in a room with a bunch of bots after buying into what's supposed to be a multiplayer game.

I'd say read the communitiy forum before you decide.

Overall, it's neat and has potential, but it's not done baking yet.
Not recommended yet.

Not worth the money, since multiplayer doesn't work properly. And I only bought it because of that. There are free singleplayer competitor games.

In 99% of the time when I join a room, and it says, that people should be in there, there is noone. 

I guess, if you always play with a friend, then it's worth it.

I really like the concept of this game and I hope to see more games like this come out. Very enjoyable and keeps me focused on my tasks. However, I do have some major issues with the game. The main one is that the kuroda pets grow based on real time. As someone who works and has a social life, I'm not able to be glued to my computer 24/7 to keep track of my in game tasks. I'm sure most people who have a life outside of this game would agree that it's very annoying to have the pets grow based on how productive you are. Not only that, but the letters you receive from theses pets are annoying too. 

 My other issue with the game is the lack of avatar customization so far. Mostly the lack of different skin  colors. I'm sure after a few more updates, the devs will deal with that. I'd suggest focusing on the skin colors and also maybe add a color wheel with hex codes you can enter.

 My third issue with the game is the bugs that come with it. Every so often my game will crash and all of my tasks are gone and replaced with "To Do" My game also freezes sometimes when I'm editing my rooms. 

Other than all that, it's a pretty neat game. Looking forward to new updates.

I mean, I really do like this game, but it falls short on many accounts. I have a lot of graphic issues during the room design process and the colour palette is extremely limiting. I like that I'm able to import photos, but there's no aspect ratio described for 99% of these items and they really do need it because they are not intuitive at all. I haven't had issues making darker skin as a COLOUR, but the lines for the mouth and all that stay as the regular grey-ish and it looks awful. I wish there was a lot more options for furniture; more options for natural-looking pillows, blankets, etc. Some items that should go together(like the bed + pillows) do not at all, it's not cohesive. The grid is also INFURIATING. why isn't it lined up with the wall??

When it comes to the actual studying part of the game, I think it does exactly as it's supposed to, I mean, it's not a very complex feature. I don't think this would make me any more likely to study(and it hasn't so far), but with multiplayer the whole body-doubling aspect of it might change that up. All-in-all it's very cute and relaxing to watch, but mostly as a second-screen kind of thing.

I encounter a of bugs, I've had rooms not save(A LOT, might be a cloud issue im not sure), etc. common issues that make me never wanna play again(for a week) but I can get over it.

That being said, it is a very relaxing game with a lot of potential. I think in a few updates I will be able to recommend this game, but for now, it's lacking a lot of what I'm looking for ntm I'm STILL failing all my classes.

features that would be great:
- steam workshop (would LOVEEE this)
- play local audio files in-game
- resizing of 3D objects(like the cube, sphere, wtv make them longer or skinnier or shorter or fatter)

no chat: refund - doesn't make sense to me not having chat lobbies or various options at at least.

no. it is not distracting. why would it be? you are the devs - implement 'options'. give it a show/hide toggle, mute option, block option, opt-in prompts, per room settings, c'mon.

or simply revert the fake multiplayer part and advertise it as what it is. I really don't enjoy sitting in a room with a bunch of bots after buying into what's supposed to be a multiplayer game.

Dev has have been making questionable choice recently in managing the public rooms.
I'd say read the communitiy forum before you decide.
This game tries to be everything but offers too little to stand out on it's own. Why have this game open when I could actually have productive tools on the screen?

Great start guys. A few hours in and got softlocked in the music area forcing me to quit the game and reopen it. So I'm not seeing this one steam's award system so far, But it is a pretty chill damn game though I will give that

[h3] Update [/h3]: Crashes every once in awhile and now just stays on this blue screen after the logo pops up making it unplayable, don't recommend this game now until they fix this

EDIT: Please bring back "Nearby Rooms". "Public Rooms" are nice to have but not as a direct replacement, as it's much worse for trying to find your favorite rooms, and the terrible horizontal scroll UI doesn't help. We love gogh because of the bonds we have with the community, but this update tore some communities apart. My review will remain negative until the issue is resolved.

This game fixed my productive life ヾ(≧▽≦*)o
